Welcome to Getting Started with Sphinx’s documentation!¶

System.py¶

The core module of my example project

class System.System¶

An example docstring for a class definition.

add_absorbance_protocol(exp_time, label, plate_index, order)¶

Function to add an Absorbance protocol to the list of protocols to execute for a particular PlateConfiguration

Parameters:
  • {integer} -- exposure time with which to collect absorbance spectrum in milliseconds (exp_time) –
  • {string} -- protocol label, should be set to 'Absorbance' (label) –
  • {integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList in which to select wells (plate_index) –
  • {integer} -- the index of the protocol in the existing list of protocols of the plate configuration object. (order) –
  • this is the first protocol that is being added to the PlateConfiguration object then the order is equal to zero. If it is the second, then the order is equal to 1 and so on. (If) –
add_auxiliary_protocol(aux_index, duration, label, plate_index, order)¶

Function to add an Auxiliary protocol to the list of protocols to execute for a particular PlateConfiguration. The auxiliary protocol type is defined by the aux_index input.

Parameters:
  • {integer} -- possible values 1, 2, 3 or 4 representing which auxiliary port will be triggerd on. (aux_index) –
  • {integer} -- duration for how long to trigger the selected auxiliary port for. (duration) –
  • {string} -- protocol label, should be set to 'Auxiliary' (label) –
  • {integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList in which to select wells (plate_index) –
  • {integer} -- the index of the protocol in the existing list of protocols of the plate configuration object. (order) –
  • this is the first protocol that is being added to the PlateConfiguration object then the order is equal to zero. If it is the second, then the order is equal to 1 and so on. (If) –
add_fluorescence_protocol(exp_time, led_index, wavelength_led_1, wavelength_led_2, wavelength_led_3, label, plate_index, order)¶

Function to add an Fluorescence protocol to the list of protocols to execute for a particular PlateConfiguration

Parameters:
  • {integer} -- exposure time with which to collect absorbance spectrum in milliseconds (exp_time) –
  • {integer} -- possible values 1,2 or 3 representing which LED to use for protocol. Only 1 LED per protocol. (led_index) –
  • {integer} -- wavelength of LED 1 (wavelength_led_1) –
  • {integer} -- wavelength of LED 2 (wavelength_led_2) –
  • {integer} -- wavelength of LED 3 (wavelength_led_3) –
  • {string} -- protocol label, should be set to 'Fluorescence' (label) –
  • {integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList in which to select wells (plate_index) –
  • {integer} -- the index of the protocol in the existing list of protocols of the plate configuration object. (order) –
  • this is the first protocol that is being added to the PlateConfiguration object then the order is equal to zero. If it is the second, then the order is equal to 1 and so on. (If) –
clear_wells(plate_index)¶

Function used to unselect (clear) all the wells from the PlateConfiguration object

Parameters:{integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList in which to unselect wells (plate_index) –
get_current_plate_type()¶

Function to attain the type of plate (24 or 96 well) of the current PlateConfiguration object

Returns:integer – plate type of current PlateConfiguration object being edited. Returns 24 (for 24-well plate) or 96 (for 96-well plate).
get_plate_count()¶

Used to attain the number of PlateConfiguration objects added to the system.

Returns:integer – number of PlateConfiguration objects in self.plateList.
get_selected_wells(plate_index)¶

Returns a list of all the wells which were selected for protocol execution.

Parameters:
  • {integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList from which the selected wells (plate_index) –
  • to be extracted from. (are) –
Returns:

[list] – Each element in list is the label (as a string) of a well which was selected. If well A1 was selected, then the list would contain the element ‘A1’.
get_settings()¶

Returns the current settings of the system.

Returns:[list] – The list is made up of four elements. The first 3 elements represent the wavelengths of LEDs 1, 2, and 3 respectively. The fourth element of the list represents the number of scans to average.
load_calibration_data(platetype, filename='')¶

Return the most important thing about a person.

Parameters:
  • platetype – A string indicating the name of the person.
  • filename – A filename of the calibration data
load_settings()¶

Used to automatically load the saved settings for the OSP software. Settings include the light source wavelengths and the number of scans to average. The settings are stored as a pickle file in System Settings directory.

load_well_labels()¶

Creates the necessary list to store the well labels in form of ‘well_rowcolumn’. For example the entry in the list for A2 would be ‘well_A2’. Also creates a list to store the selection status of a particular well as either ‘OFF’ (not selected) or ‘ON’ (selected).

remove_plate_object(plate_numb)¶

Function to remove a PlateConfiguration object from self.plateList. If object is removed the indices of all other plates are fixed to account for the removal.

Parameters:
  • {integer} -- integer representing the index of the PlateConfiguration object in (plate_numb) –
  • For this variable, an input of 1 would represent the first entry in self.plateList. (self.plateList.) –
save_settings()¶

Used to automatically save the system settings for the OSP software. Settings include the light source wavelengths and the number of scans to average. The settings are stored as a pickle file in System Settings directory.

select_all_wells(plate_index)¶

Function used to select all the wells in the PlateConfiguration object

Parameters:{integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList in which to select wells (plate_index) –
select_wells(plate_index, well_list)¶

Function used to select the wells for protocol execution in a specific PlateConfiguration

Parameters:
  • {integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList in which to select wells (plate_index) –
  • {list} -- a list of the well indices, where well A1 is indexed at 0 and indices increase along the rows. (well_list) –
  • example, in a 24-well plate, the indices of the first row wells A1-A6 = 0-5, second row B1-B6 = 6-11, etc (For) –
set_current_plate(index)¶

Function to keep track of the index of the PlateConfiguration which is being edited.

Parameters:{integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in the self.plateList list (index) –
set_plate_type(platetype)¶

This function initializes a new PlateConfiguration object which will be used to keep track of which wells are selected and which protocols to execute for the selected wells. The newly created PlateConfiguration object is added to a list allowing it be accessed later on. This function is executed every time a new set of protocols is desired to be run on a different group of wells (a new PlateConfiguration needed).

Parameters:platetype – possible value of 24 (for 24-well plate) or 96 (for 96-well plate).
turn_kinetic_tracking_on(method, interval, duration, reps, label, plate_index, order)¶

Function to turn on the system kinetic mode. This enables the user to input protocols into a kinetic sequence which can be looped for a desired time period or repeated a specific number of times.

The interval method allows the user to perform a series of protocols in intervals for a specified duration of time. For example, executing an Absorbance protocol very 30 seconds for 20 minutes.

The repetiion method allows the user to repeatedly perform a series of protocols. For example, executing an Absorbance protocol 10 times in a row.

Parameters:
  • {integer} -- possible value 1 (method) –
  • {integer} -- interval time for a kinetic protocol (interval) –
  • {integer} -- the duration to perform the kinetic protocol sequence (duration) –
  • {integer} -- number of times to repeat the kinetic protocol sequence (reps) –
  • {string} -- protocol label, should be set to 'Kinetic' (label) –
  • {integer} -- index of the PlateConfiguration object in self.plateList in which to select wells (plate_index) –
  • {integer} -- the index of the protocol in the existing list of protocols of the plate configuration object. (order) –
  • this is the first protocol that is being added to the PlateConfiguration object then the order is equal to zero. If it is the second, then the order is equal to 1 and so on. (If) –
